thread.title: ICYMI: Frank Kaminsky trolled Cubs fans
thread.title_full: ICYMI: Frank Kaminsky trolled Cubs fans | Chicago Sun-Times

author: | emailAddress.indexOf('@') == -1) {errorString = 'Please enter your email address';} var isError = false; if (errorString.length > 0) isError = true; if (isError) alert(errorString); return !isError;}
title: ICYMI: Frank Kaminsky trolled Cubs fans
text:
Awash in their self-pity on Wednesday night, misty-eyed Cubs fans might have missed some of the taunting tweets fired in their direction from White Sox fans.
One of the loudest, if not the tallest, White Sox fans trolling Cubdom was none other than Frank Kaminsky, the college player of the year and first-round draft pick of the Charlotte Hornets who can tweet with the best of them.
The loyal White Sox fan got it rolling with this:
All I know is this is going to be a great World Series. #MetsBandwagon #DannyMurphy
— Frank Kaminsky III (@FSKPart3) October 22, 2015
Then came a barrage of rapid-fire shots at people unfollowing him:
I hate the Cubs almost as much as I hate the fact that you took time out of your life to tweet this at me. https://t.co/9mbzMSeTp8
— Frank Kaminsky III (@FSKPart3) October 22, 2015
Oh God no, anything but that! https://t.co/H4ENxOxsrv
— Frank Kaminsky III (@FSKPart3) October 22, 2015
Live for nothing, die for anything https://t.co/IGGBgUN1jh
— Frank Kaminsky III (@FSKPart3) October 22, 2015
Then a retweet:
World Series-bound trolling. pic.twitter.com/jFbBbfRNfX
— Meredith Shiner (@meredithshiner) October 22, 2015
Followed by:
@FSKPart3 love ya Frank, but I must unfollow now. Bye.
— Matthew Meyrick (@TheMrCubbieBlue) October 22, 2015
Don't let the door hit ya on the way out #WhatsLoveGotToDoWithIt https://t.co/OnJo17tTvN
— Frank Kaminsky III (@FSKPart3) October 22, 2015
Damn. An organization that makes you bleed for 109 years. How selfish of them #StopTheViolence https://t.co/rRolnC0dtN
— Frank Kaminsky III (@FSKPart3) October 22, 2015
Another retweet:
ten years a go? no remember pic.twitter.com/BXDkXQyUpd
— Ozzie Guillen FND (@OzzieGuillen) October 22, 2015
And, finally:
@OzzieGuillen @FSKPart3 Sox fans live in the past, Cub fans live for the future
— EBROSE (@EBROSE_21) October 22, 2015
And how's that workin out for ya? https://t.co/itZ4mHIEsN
— Frank Kaminsky III (@FSKPart3) October 22, 2015
If you want to get back at him, Cubs fans, just ask him about his dancing:
Or what’s on his playlist:
